description:
Variation of condition HN11 of planning permission P03/1185 which states: 'The 9 car parking spaces approved at the rear of the building shall only be used by disabled users and for operational purposes in connection with the use of the ground floor premises'.
To read as varied: 'Three of the nine car parking spaces approved at the rear of the building shall only be used by disabled users and for operational purposes in connection with the use of the ground floor premises, the remaining six will be used by mobility impaired users in connection with the proposed development (ref: P092307) at 295 Holloway Road'.
Please note, this application has been submitted in connection with application ref: P092307, at the adjoining site at 295 Holloway Road which proposes the following: 'Demolition of the metro bar publich house (Class A4) and the erection of a part 8, part 12 storey building (reaching a maximum height of 40 metres), to provide 260sqm of flexible Class A1 and/or A2 and/or A3 and/or A4 and/or A5 floor space at ground floor level, 138 hotel rooms and 36 hotel apartment lets on upper levels, together with associated works'.
decision_conditions: REASON: The proposed variation of Condition HN11 to re-designate the disabled parking spaces of the application site for the benefit of an adjoining development, in this case the proposed development (ref: P092307) at 295 Holloway Road, would give rise to conditions prejudicial to the use and amenities of the application site, contrary to policies T21, T28, T55 of Islington's Unitary Development Plan 2002 and policy 3C.23 of the London Plan 2008.
